pros: Good benefit package. Mid range pay. Excellent teaching staff. Nice people. Lots of free parking. All employees know and care about each other
cons: Not a lot of upward mobility. Every dept is on a tight budget and pursestrings are controlled by home school in Japan

pros: The students are amazing Lots of fun events You gain long lasting friendships
cons: Management is horrible and ruins the experience Not paid enough Staff has beef with RAs all the time for little to no reason You will struggle to have a work life balance here

review_title: Learn Independence, Be a Positive Influence to Young Female Students
pros: Free room and board plus stipend as a student is very rare to find. Many opportunities to learn from the foreign students and positively influence their lives. Director of Student Life very caring and compassionate.
cons: Highest level of school management (abroad and local) can be slow-moving to make changes--language barrier may be reason for difficulties interfacing foreign and local administrations. No budget for expected outings, and celebrations can mean spending cash on your own students if you don't plan well for free activities.

review_title: Good experience, only a few problems
pros:
Free 3 meals a day
Free housing
Beautiful campus
Nice staff
Hands off supervisor (you don't report to your boss every day like other jobs) 
Ability to plan and be creative with your tutorials(tutorials are 1 hour activities you do Monday-Thursday)
Decent pay... Starts at 110 per week so about 400 a month
cons:
A lot of money spent out of pocket on students with no reimbursement 
No opportunity to report overtime hours(and trust me you will work overtime)
RAs can be cliquey - ignore it and find the nice mature ones
Some weekdays and weekends you will have to stay in the dorm (3-4 times a week)
Some students are great but others can be a nightmare

review_title: Hasty, often overwhelming, but worth it all the way
job_title: Resident Assistant in Fort Spokane, WA
pros:
Rich Japanese cultural experience
Free meals, electricity, utilities, maintenance, and housing in dorms
Free tickets to certain local events
Extremely beautiful campus with running track and a view
Historical buildings with nice facilities
Access to a library with DVDs, CDs, games, and more
Current Student Life Director is very accommodating and nice
Living rooms with LCD tvs and blue ray players
Covington dorms have a bathroom for each room
Security present 24-7
Interim housing free during winter, $100 a month in summer
Small compensation for money spent on tutorials
cons:
Some groups are kind and cooperative, others are not
Housekeeping staff is rude
Management sometimes forgetful or notifies RAs last minute about events
RAs sometimes blamed for issues caused by students
On top of schooling, RAs teach 4 one hour tutorials M-R - which seems unnecessary
Staff pays RAs for only 20 hours of work each week
Returning RAs must review student orientation process at beginning of every term

pros:
If you like and is interested in Japan and its culture and you are a female, then this will be a great job for you. 
The students you live with will become almost like your family and best friends. 
You will be able to learn lot about the Japanese culture and even learn or improve your Japanese language abilities.
Free housing and meals.
Obtain leadership and management skills.
Making lots of friends in Japan and other colleges around Spokane.
cons:
You have to be a part/full time student to be a resident assistant.
Your performance and employment are based on the work and time you put in with your students.
May not have a lot of social time. You will have a 10PM curfew at least 3 to 4 times week.
Communication difficulties with students who cannot understand or speak English very well.
Outings with your charges may cost you money.

job_title: Lead Banquet Server in Spokane, WA
pros:
It is the most laid back and unsupervised environment ever. So you can get away with doing the bare minimum or nothing at all like everyone else.
There is healthcare and dental but only if you can snag a full time position which is few and far between.
cons: There is absolutely no management here. The bosses don't care about anybody or anything so don't expect much from them. The structure of this entire company is awful. If there is an issue, it will never get fixed. If you are looking for a raise or any kind of advancement, you will get dragged along and receive empty promise after promise. You will never get anywhere with this dead end job. Trust me, I worked there for over 5 years.

review_title: Great if you don't care about being cared for.
pros: Free parking, relaxed environment and dress code, free food most of the time.
cons: The budgets for each department are low. Absolutely no loyalty. Extreme lack of possible upward movement unless someone dies, or quits. Overall, just a unfortunately ran company. Japan controls all movements, and refuses to allow for a normal pay scale.

pros: Good salary for part time work.
cons: It's hard to get hired full time.
